siteMetadata.title: Complete Intro to Databases
siteMetadata.description: Get a complete intro to reading and writing to database from Brian Holt on MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Neo4j

frontmatter.title: Introduction
frontmatter.description: Welcome to the Complete Intro to Databases! Brian goes over what you need to know to get started.

frontmatter.title: Installation Notes
frontmatter.description: Brian gives you notes on how you can install the various databases you will be using in this course.

frontmatter.title: Terminology
frontmatter.description: Brian discusses what databases are, what the various type we will cover, and get you in the mindset of storing data.

frontmatter.title: NoSQL
frontmatter.description: Brian introduces the first style of database in the course, NoSQL. He goes over what the term means and leads into the example NoSQL you are going to work with, MongoDB.

frontmatter.title: MongoDB
frontmatter.description: MongoDB is a document-based NoSQL database that allows developers to write unstructured data to be queried later. Brian goes into what this means for a developer and when you might want to use it

frontmatter.title: Querying MongoDB
frontmatter.description: After inserting documents into MongoDB, you are going to want to be able to query those documents. Brian shows you how in this section to write find queries for MongoDB.

frontmatter.title: Updating MongoDB
frontmatter.description: Brian shows you how to update and delete the documents that have been inserted into the database.

frontmatter.title: Indexes in MongoDB
frontmatter.description: When querying against MongoDB, query performance can be very important. Brian shows you how to think about indexing a MongoDB database to improve performance and capabilities.

frontmatter.title: Write a Node.js app with MongoDB
frontmatter.description: Brian shows you a quick project to demonstrate how to translate these command line concepts into code with a Node.js app to query our pets database

frontmatter.title: MongoDB Ops
frontmatter.description: While developers don't necessarily need to know how to run a database cluster in production, it can be important to know how and why databases are being run the way they are. Brian gives a brief treatise on the various features of MongoDB's operations aspects.

frontmatter.title: Intro to SQL Database
frontmatter.description: The most common databases today are relational databases. Brian goes over the landscape of current SQL-based relational databases and some of their features.

frontmatter.title: PostgreSQL
frontmatter.description: PostgreSQL is a relational database that lets developers write amazing apps. Brian goes over how to get PostgreSQL started on your computer and help you write your first query.

frontmatter.title: Querying PostgreSQL
frontmatter.description: SQL is a very flexible and expressive way to describe what data you want out of a database. In this section Brian talks about the various ways to read from and modify a database using SQL.

frontmatter.title: Complex SQL Queries
frontmatter.description: Brian dives into how to compound queries, joins, unions, group bys, and other ways to get obtain powerful results with the expressiveness of SQL

frontmatter.title: JSON in PostgreSQL
frontmatter.description: One of PostgreSQL's super powers is that it's able to store and query JSON

frontmatter.title: Node.js App with PostgreSQL
frontmatter.description: To help transfer learnings from the command line to code, Brian shows you how to quickly write an app for our message board tables using Node.js

frontmatter.title: Hasura
frontmatter.description: Brian gives a quick overview of a powerful tool to use with PostgreSQL, Hasura. Hasura is a service you will put in your cluster so you can query your PostgreSQL database with GraphQL.

frontmatter.title: PostgreSQL Ops
frontmatter.description: While it is not important for a developer to know how to precisely manage a database cluster in production, a developer does need to know a bit how about how it is done so they can plan accordingly when they write their code.

frontmatter.title: Graph Databases
frontmatter.description: Graph databases are great when you need to define relations between objects that can have complex webs of relations especially for things like social networks.

frontmatter.title: Neo4j
frontmatter.description: Graph databases are great when you need to define relations between objects that can have complex webs of relations especially for things like social networks.

frontmatter.title: Neo4j Browser
frontmatter.description: An amazing tool that Neo4j provides dev is a built in browser that allows you run queries and visualize your graph

frontmatter.title: Complex Neo4j Queries
frontmatter.description: Graph databases are great when you need to define relations between objects that can have complex webs of relations especially for things like social networks.

frontmatter.title: Node.js App with Neo4j
frontmatter.description: Time to put some of that graph magic into practice! Put together with Brian an app to find the smallest path between two people in a graph.

frontmatter.title: Neo4j Ops
frontmatter.description: Brian talks for a second about what things to consider with Neo4j running in production.
